intro: Coussapoa napoensis, commonly known as the Napo sphaerocarpa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in humid, lowland areas with rich soil. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
